description: South Korea’s anti-corruption watchdog has secured a warrant extension to arrest impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol and a second attempt to take the embattled leader into custody could happen as early as Wednesday.
title: Impeached South Korean President Yoon Faces Second Arrest Threat

description: It’s been a while since Denmark has been the object of Donald Trump’s enduring obsession with Greenland and needing to remind the returning president repeatedly that the world’s largest island isn’t for sale.
title: Trump’s Relentless Greenland Fixation Puts Denmark in Spotlight

description: Good morning, it's Georgie here in Sydney. Here’s what you need to know today.Today’s must-reads:• Australia housing downturn could be short lived• Buyout firms target slice of Australia’s pensions system• Hedge funds load up on Aussie dollar short bets
title: Australia’s House Price Drop to Be Shallow

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economic statecraft editor Nick Wadhams looks at how President-elect Donald Trump is ready to push US foreign policy to precedent-shattering levels. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Vision of US ‘Golden Age’ Includes Canada, Greenland, Canal

description: A cohort of about 20 Republican House members from New York, New Jersey and California was invited to meet with President-elect Donald Trump at his Mar-a-Lago estate Saturday ahead of a looming fight over an extension of his 2017 tax cuts.
title: Trump Calls SALT-Focused Republicans to Florida Before Tax Fight

description: A British politician said he had “almost zero confidence” in the integrity of Shein’s supply chain following a heated exchange with a representative of the fast-fashion retailer in London.
title: Shein Blasted by UK MP for Giving No Confidence in Supply Chain

description: Venezuela’s opposition leader Edmundo González said his son-in-law was kidnapped on Tuesday in Caracas just days before his vowed return to the capital.
title: Venezuela Opposition Leader Says Son-in-Law Kidnapped in Caracas

description: In the space of an hour, President-elect Donald Trump called for absorbing Canada, declined to rule out using military force to seize the Panama Canal and Greenland, demanded NATO allies spend 5% of GDP on defense and vowed “all hell would break loose” in the Middle East if Hamas doesn’t release Israeli hostages before he takes office.
title: Trump’s Panama, Greenland Threats Signal Unchained Second Term

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s pick to oversee what he has promised to be the country’s largest ever deportation effort says he will need tens of billions of dollars to carry out the mission, but it will ultimately reduce taxpayers’ burden.
title: Trump Border Czar Sees $86 Billion Cost to Target Migrants

description: It no longer sounds like a joke.
title: Trump Says He’d Use ‘Economic Force’ to Make Canada 51st State

description: President-elect Donald Trump said Tuesday he would seek to have a policy of having no wind farms constructed during his second term, threatening billions of dollars in planned wind projects.
title: Trump Says He Wants No Wind Turbines Built During Administration

description: President-elect Donald Trump said NATO nations should spend the equivalent of 5% of their economic output on defense, ramping up his demands on European allies to more than double the current target.
title: Trump Says NATO Nations Should Spend 5% of GDP on Defense

description: Nvidia Corp.’s Jensen Huang, the CEO at the center of the artificial intelligence boom, said he’s ready to meet US President-elect Donald Trump and offer his help to the coming administration.
title: Nvidia CEO Says He’d Be Delighted to Meet and Congratulate Trump

description: US President-elect Donald Trump’s incoming special envoy to the Middle East said negotiators were on the verge of a deal to secure the release of hostages taken by Hamas in its war against Israel.
title: Trump Envoy to Middle East Says Hostage Deal With Hamas Is Close

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he would not promise to avoid a military confrontation over his desire to bring Greenland or the Panama Canal under US control.
title: Trump Won’t Rule Out US Military Taking Greenland, Panama Canal

description: A federal judge in Florida issued an order Tuesday blocking the Justice Department from releasing a final report on two criminal probes into President-elect Donald Trump’s conduct.
title: US Judge in Florida Blocks Special Counsel’s Trump Report

description: Mauritius ordered authorities to arrest former Finance Minister Renganaden Padayachy, the second casualty of an audit of public finances under the new government of Prime Minister Navinchandra Ramgoolam, if he tries to leave the country.
title: Mauritius Extends Fraud Probe to Former Finance Minister

description: Bangladesh’s anti-money laundering agency requested information on the domestic bank accounts of UK City Minister Tulip Siddiq, who’s also the niece of ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, a potential precursor to a broader financial investigation.
title: Bangladesh to Probe Hasina’s Niece, UK City Minister Tulip Siddiq

description: President-elect Donald Trump announced an investment of at least $20 billion from Hussain Sajwani, the head of Damac Group, to build new data centers in the US.
title: Trump, Dubai Billionaire Unveil $20 Billion for Data Centers

description: Honduras’ government has started efforts to “reprofile” public debt as President Xiomara Castro seeks to free up funds for investment.
title: Honduras Government Begins Bid to Reprofile Public Debt

description: The Biden administration sanctioned the head of the Rapid Support Forces paramilitary group in Sudan, announcing the move at the same time that it determined the group was guilty of genocide.
title: US Sanctions Sudanese Paramilitary Group Leader Dagalo

description: The US placed sanctions on Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s influential cabinet chief for his alleged role in corruption, just days before Orban’s ally Donald Trump takes over in the White House.
title: US Sanctions Orban’s Cabinet Chief Rogan for Alleged Corruption

description: Canada’s tax authority will continue applying the higher capital gains inclusion rate despite Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s suspension of Parliament.
title: Canada to Apply Capital Gains Tax Change Despite Government Halt

description: The FBI and Department of Homeland Security have scaled back efforts over the past two years to disrupt violent extremists’ online activities, according to current and former US officials and internet radicalization specialists who fear the trend will accelerate under the incoming Trump administration.
title: US Pulls Back From Disrupting Violent Extremism on Social Media

description: A Guinean court sentenced opposition leader Mamadou Aliou Bah to two years in prison for insulting the nation’s transitional president, General Mamadi Doumbouya.
title: Guinea Jails Opposition Leader for Insulting Junta Chief

description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen rebuffed President-elect Donald Trump’s wish to buy Greenland but welcomed US investment in the self-ruling territory.
title: Denmark Backs US Investment in Greenland While Refusing Sale

description: Four-week average flows are the smallest since August 2023
title: Russia’s Crude Shipments Tumble to the Lowest in 16 Months

description: Egypt will hold talks with Somalia next week to discuss Cairo’s troop contribution inside a multilateral force battling Islamist insurgents in the Horn of Africa nation.
title: Egypt to Hold Talks on Sending Peacekeeping Troops to Somalia

description: Herbert Kickl, the conservative-nationalist tasked this week with forming Austria’s next government, is at once one of the most admired and loathed politicians in the country’s post-World War II history.
title: Austria’s Far-Right Chancellor-in-Waiting Is a Canny Provocateur

description: Malawi former Finance Minister Joseph Mwanamvekha was charged with seven counts of fraud and one of money laundering related to the alleged misappropriation of public funds during his Democratic Progressive Party’s last term in power that ended in 2020.
title: Malawi’s Former Finance Minister Faces Fraud Charges

description: An organization in Mozambique asked the nation’s attorney-general to probe “severe human-rights violations” after a jail break, saying security forces killed at least 100 recaptured prisoners and buried them in mass graves.
title: Maputo Prison Killings See Mozambique Watchdog File Complaint

description: Latin America is becoming a battleground of government spending extremes, drawing calls from smaller nations to tighten the belt before the consequences spill across borders.
title: Between Milei and Lula, Paraguay Finance Chief Eyes Austere Path

description: Jean-Marie Le Pen, the founder of France’s National Front who ran for president five times and lived to see his anti-immigrant rhetoric go mainstream, has died. He was 96.
title: Jean-Marie Le Pen, Architect of France’s Far Right, Dies at 96

description: African officials pushed back after French President Emmanuel Macron said that some of their nations owed their sovereignty to France after its troops intervened in their countries.
title: African Leaders Push Back at Macron’s Remarks They Owe Their Sovereignty to France

description: Singapore’s parliament has passed a law allowing the police to control the bank accounts of individuals who are suspected to be the targets of scams.
title: Singapore Passes Bill Empowering Police to Protect Scam Victims

description: France’s Socialist Party is willing to compromise on the budget, opening a narrow path for Prime Minister Francois Bayrou’s new government to avoid collapse in its efforts to repair creaking public finances.
title: France’s Socialists Open to Compromise to Exit Budget Crisis

description: The billionaire is exploiting the soft underbelly of a big-state, small-tech continent.
title: Elon Musk’s Euro Trolling Puts a Rocket Under SpaceX

description: John Mahama was inaugurated as Ghana’s president on Tuesday, returning to the office he held eight years ago following his commanding victory in December elections.
title: Ghana’s Mahama Resumes Power After Eight Years in Opposition

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Canada’s Trump Planning Jolted by Trudeau Exit

description: A Seoul court has extended the arrest warrant for impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, after the lead investigating agency asked for additional time.
title: South Korea Court Extends Yoon’s Arrest Warrant Over Martial Law

description: President Joe Biden will establish two new national monuments that will protect 848,000 acres of lands in California, according to the White House.
title: Biden Protects 848,000 Acres by Creating Two National Monuments

description: Justin Trudeau has been Canada’s prime minister since November 2015, longer than any other leader of a major western democracy. But a series of political fumbles — including the scathing resignation of his finance minister, one of his closest allies — caught up to him, and members of his Liberal Party have now forced his resignation.
title: Why Canada’s Conservative Party Is Surging as Trudeau Fades

description: Indonesia has become the newest member of the BRICS group of developing nations, in a move that could further bolster the Global South as Donald Trump’s trade policies pose risks to world economy.
title: Indonesia Joins BRICS to Help Boost Global South on World Stage

description: Finland is about to complete a safety inspection on the detained Eagle S tanker that damaged undersea cables in the Baltic Sea last month.
title: Finland to Complete Safety Inspection on Detained Tanker

description: A Philippine lawmaker is seeking to revive ABS-CBN Corp., the nation’s largest broadcaster before its shutdown during former President Rodrigo Duterte’s administration.
title: Philippine Lawmaker Seeks to Revive TV Firm Shut Under Duterte

description: Singapore has proposed a new law that includes establishing controls on “race-based” business groups and clan associations in a bid to safeguard racial harmony and curb foreign influence.
title: Singapore Floats More Controls on ‘Race-Based’ Business Groups

description: Spot container rates for shipping goods to the US from Asia have spiked over the past month as companies look to avoid higher tariffs and pad their inventories ahead of a strike threatening to close ports responsible for roughly half of the nation’s seaborne trade volumes.
title: Shipping Rates Start 2025 With a Spike on Tariff, Strike Worries

description: China is pressing local officials to deliver on plans to build a unified national market, issuing guidelines for improving competition and dismantling barriers to access as Beijing looks to expand domestic demand.
title: China Details Steps to Form Unified Market Free of Local Hurdles

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s aim to recast Europe’s largest economy with semiconductor subsidies is foundering after Intel’s big project went awry.
title: German Dream of Becoming a Global Chip Superpower Is Fading Fast

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen told China’s Vice Premier He Lifeng of her “serious concern” regarding “malicious cyber activity” a week after the US said Chinese state-sponsored hackers had breached the Treasury Department’s computer networks.
title: Yellen Tells China’s Vice Premier Hacks Raise ‘Serious Concern’

description: President-elect Donald Trump is opposing the release of Justice Department Special Counsel Jack Smith’s final report, which his lawyers say accuses Trump of engaging “in an unprecedented criminal effort,” according to a new court filing.
title: Trump Presses to Block Release of DOJ Special Counsel Report

description: The Philippines has accused a giant Chinese coast guard vessel it dubbed as the “Monster” of maintaining an “illegal presence” in its exclusive economic zone as Beijing ramps up activities in the disputed South China Sea.
title: Philippines Confronts China’s ‘Monster’ Ship in Disputed Sea

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken lauded the close economic and security partnership between the US and Japan, about two weeks ahead of President-elect Donald Trump’s return to the White House.
title: Blinken Reaffirms Ties With Japan Ahead of Trump’s Return

description: The prime minister’s resignation marks both the end of a political era and the beginning of a potentially dramatic reshaping of the nation’s economy.
title: Canada Tilts Right as Inflation Claims Trudeau as Latest Victim

description: Capital Group said it was the money manager affected by a front-running case that led India’s market regulator to once again ban Ketan Parekh, a former stock broker who shook the nation’s market at the turn of the century with one of the worst scandals in its history.
title: Capital Group Is the Affected Party in India Front-Running Case

description: Donald Trump has nominated a state court judge from Long Island to be US Attorney for the Eastern District of New York, a key prosecutor’s office that has aggressively brought cases involving malfeasance on Wall Street and beyond.
title: Trump Nominates Long Island Judge for Brooklyn US Attorney

description: Chinese oil major Cnooc Ltd. and Cosco Shipping Holdings Co., the country’s biggest marine transport line, have been blacklisted by the US government for alleged links with the People’s Liberation Army.
title: China Oil Major and Top Shipping Line Blacklisted by Washington

description: President Joe Biden offered condolences and pledged federal support at a prayer service with family members of the victims of the New Year’s Day attack in New Orleans.
title: Biden Pledges Support to New Orleans During Memorial Service

description: Ghana’s lawmakers have unanimously approved Alban Bagbin as Speaker of Parliament for another four years.
title: Ghana Lawmakers Return Alban Bagbin as Speaker of Parliament

description: Mark Carney, the former governor of the Bank of Canada and Bank of England, said he’s considering entering the race to replace Justin Trudeau as Canada’s prime minister.
title: Mark Carney Says He’s Considering Running to Succeed Trudeau

description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said the nation’s new hypersonic missile will keep any rivals in the Pacific region in check, following a test launch on Monday that coincided with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s visit to Seoul.
title: Kim Jong Un Says Hypersonic Missile Will Contain Pacific Rivals

description: Chinese-state sponsored hackers penetrated the executive branch of the Philippines government and stole sensitive data as part of a yearslong campaign, according to three people familiar with the matter.
title: Chinese Hackers Target Philippine President, Steal Military Data
